'''Tû''' was a [[Fays|fay]], and the king of the [[Hisildi]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.

His dwelling was in an underground lake near [[Koivië-néni]].<ref name=Tuv>{{LT1|X}}, p. 232</ref>

== History ==
Tû was a wizard, "more skilled in magics than any that have dwelt ever yet beyond the land of [[Valinor]]", who became a king among the [[Ilkorindi]], the [[Elves]] who never left [[Palisor]]. Those Elves that followed him afterwards became known as the [[Hisildi]], and he taught them much lore and wisdom.<ref name=Tuv/>

According to one text, when an [[Elves|Elf]] called [[Nuin]] discovered the sleeping bodies of [[Men]] at [[Murmenalda]], Tû subsequently forbade the Elves to wake them or even to visit them, fearing the wrath of [[Ilúvatar]].<ref>{{LT1|X}}, ''The Awakening of Men according to the earlier outlines'', pp. 235-6</ref>

However, despite this warning, Nuin still visited the sleeping Men, and eventually woke two of them, later called [[Ermon]] and [[Elmir]], and taught them [[Ilkorin|his]] speech. After the [[awakening of Men]], [[Melko]] learned of them, and sent his creatures after the Elves and the newly awakened Men,  from which Tû protected them.<ref name=Thu>{{LT1|X}}, ''The Awakening of Men according to the earlier outlines'', p. 236</ref>

According to another text, Tû eventually "faded before the [[Sun]] and hid in the bottomless caverns" after Men "grew in stature".<ref>{{LT1|X}}, ''The Awakening of Men according to the later outline'', p. 237</ref>

== Other names ==
The character was originally called ''Túvo'', before being changed to ''Tû''.<ref name=Glo>{{LT1|X}}, p. 234</ref>

He was also called the '''''Lord of Gloaming'''''.<ref name=Tuv/>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In the earlier versions of his story, Tû (called ''Túvo'' in that text) was said to have met Melko in the [[halls of Mandos]] during Melko's imprisonment, and was corrupted by him. Túvo was said to have learned "much black [[magic]]" from Melko, and that after the [[darkening of Valinor]], he went to the Great Lands where he set up a "wizard kingship".<ref name=Glo/>

However, in later texts, the character of Tû lost these negative connotations,<ref name=Glo/> and instead became the protector of Elves and Men.<ref name=Thu/>
